intro: Leiothylax warmingii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
